name: assimilatory
content:
assimilatory adjective
(INTO GROUP)
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to or causing assimilation (= the process of becoming a part, or making someone become a part of a group, country, etc.): The education of these children is assimilatory and may have negative outcomes. The article discusses the assimilatory stance still held in this society. Synonym
assimilative
More examplesFewer examplesIt is very unusual for a culture to be completely transplanted, without undergoing assimilatory modifications.The school has never questioned the assimilatory aspects of its own educational practices.

assimilatory adjective
(ABSORBENT)
(also assimilative) relating to, causing, or allowing assimilation (= the process of absorbing something), especially into a living organism: Assimilatory metabolism differs between different groups of plants. We compared the amount of assimilatory tissue and the amount of structural material in a leaf. Synonym
assimilative
More examplesFewer examplesThe plants differ in their response to loss of assimilatory capacity.The team is looking at the effect of pollution on the assimilatory apparatus of tree species in this area.

assimilatory adjective
(SOUNDS)
phonetics
  specialized involving a speech sound being influenced by the sound that comes before or after it: This type of shift occurs under the assimilatory influence of a neighbouring vowel. Consonant harmony is an assimilatory process that copies features from one consonant to another consonant in the word.
